Sentencas: Previous methods to measure carbon deposition in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes do not permit simultaneous electrochemical measurements.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical measurements supplemented with carbon deposition quantities create the opportunity to further understand how carbon affects SOFC performance and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS).
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, a method for measuring carbon in situ, named here as the quantification of gasified carbon (QGC), was developed.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: TGA experiments showed that carbon with a 100 h residence time in the SOFC was >99.8% gasified.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Comparison of carbon mass measurements between the TGA and QGC show good agreement.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In situ measurements of carbon deposition in SOFCs at varying molar steam/carbon ratios were performed to further validate the QGC method, and suppression of carbon deposition with increasing steam concentration was observed, in agreement with previous studies.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The technique can be used to investigate in situ carbon deposition and gasification behavior simultaneously with electrochemical measurements for a variety of fuels and operating conditions, such as determining conditions under which incipient carbon deposition is reversible.
Titulo: Method for in situ carbon deposition measurement for solid oxide fuel cells
